intro: Gomphostemma oblongum var. helferi, commonly known as the Helfer's gomphostemma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the genus Gomphostemma. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
